customer_addr:
759 E END MOUNTAIN RD
MILL HALL, PA 17751

citations.narrative:
The licensee has not been maintaining records of guinea pig sales or the current number of animals at the facility.
Failure to maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold, or
disposed of can make it difficult to track regulated animal movement and identify trends in animal losses which could
indicate disease conditions in the guinea pigs.
The licensee must maintain records which disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold or disposed
of.
Correct by: October 5, 2023.

The guinea pig building needs a general cleaning. The walls, window sills, and ceiling have an accumulation of dust and
cobwebs. On the floors, around and under the guinea pig enclosures, there is an accumulation of hay and bedding
material.
It's important to keep animal buildings and grounds clean and in good repair to ensure the health of the animals and to
minimize odors and pests.
The premise, including building and grounds, shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from
injury and to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee has not been maintaining records of guinea pig sales or the current number of animals at the facility.  
Failure to maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold, or 
disposed of can make it difficult to track regulated animal movement and identify trends in animal losses which could 
indicate disease conditions in the guinea pigs. 
The licensee must maintain records which disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold or disposed 
of. 
Correct by: October 5, 2023. 
3.31(b)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The guinea pig building needs a general cleaning. The walls, window sills, and ceiling have an accumulation of dust and 
cobwebs. On the floors, around and under the guinea pig enclosures, there is an accumulation of hay and bedding 
material.  
It's important to keep animal buildings and grounds clean and in good repair to ensure the health of the animals and to 
minimize odors and pests.  
The premise, including building and grounds, shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from 
injury and to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
